provenance.textSnippet: A CT scan of the full chest and abdomen (with image of liver and adrenal glands) will be used in the evaluation of tumor responses, as per Table 2
provenance.rationale: The protocol explicitly states that a CT scan will be the primary imaging modality used for the evaluation of tumor responses.

provenance.textSnippet: Magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) can be conducted in cases where local laws/requirements mandate, but should have Sponsor approval prior to performing the MRI.
provenance.rationale: The protocol explicitly mentions MRI as a possible imaging modality for tumor assessments, contingent on local laws or specific requirements.

provenance.textSnippet: A CT scan of the full chest and abdomen (with image of liver and adrenal glands) will be used in the evaluation of tumor responses
provenance.rationale: The protocol specifies the chest as a required body region to be evaluated during tumor assessment imaging.

provenance.textSnippet: A CT scan of the full chest and abdomen (with image of liver and adrenal glands) will be used in the evaluation of tumor responses
provenance.rationale: The protocol specifies the abdomen, including the liver and adrenal glands, as a required body region to be evaluated during tumor assessment imaging.

provenance.textSnippet: A baseline MRI (or CT if MRI is contraindicated) of the brain is to be performed on any subject with signs or symptoms suggesting CNS involvement by tumor.
provenance.rationale: The protocol requires a brain scan as part of the tumor assessment for subjects presenting with symptoms of CNS involvement.

provenance.textSnippet: Response criteria will be assessed using RECIST (version 1.1). Changes in the measurable lesions over the course of therapy must be evaluated using the criteria listed below.
provenance.rationale: Appendix H of the protocol is dedicated to defining RECIST version 1.1 as the specific criteria for evaluating tumor response.

expansions.rationale: The protocol explicitly defines the components of Tumor Assessments, including the imaging modalities (CT, MRI), body regions to be scanned (chest, abdomen, brain), and the specific evaluation criteria (RECIST 1.1) in Section 8 and Appendix H.

provenance.rationale: This questionnaire is explicitly named as one of the two instruments used for the Quality of Life Assessment activity.

provenance.textSnippet: two questionnaires will be administered: the NCCN-Functional Assessment of Cancer Therapy (FACT) Lung Symptom Index-17 (NFLSI-17) questionnaire and the European Quality of Life-5 Dimensions (EQ-5D-5L).
